instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.5V_S3: What is 5V_S3? 5V_S3 is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S3” which is a 5 volt power rail present in an S3 state. S3 (Suspend to RAM) is a state where the system saves its context to RAM, a faster but more power-consuming method than S4. The system shuts down most components except for RAM, which remains powered to retain the system state. PM_SLP_S4_L is required for this rail to be present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping
threads.message:
hi,

i just work on that board.

it had gpu problem. I replaced the gpu and everything is working fine. i let play a video and went to lunch. when i came back after an hour it is only beeping the Ram-error code. during beeping the front led is not lightning or blinking.

I cleaned the ports and the rams, replaced it with other ones , swaped it , tryed only one in each port, nothing helps.

3.3V S0 is present
0.<SIGNAL>75V_S3</SIGNAL> is present
1.<SIGNAL>5V_S3</SIGNAL> is persent

<SIGNAL>MEM_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 0V, this could be the problem but i dont can me explained what could happend here.

need some help please

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping
threads.message: Forget it, that is usually a CPU issue on these. Either it never had a GPU problem or you killed the CPU. Also if this was already a refurb board then it also happens a lot.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping
threads.message:
thanks for the hint.

i tryed still before sending back a nice reflow for the CPU and voila i was lucky , working already over 2 days now. :-)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping
threads.message: It will fail again, update when it comes back please.

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping
threads.message: It has still 1 Month Warranty, so I hope it will fail after that, if i will get information about a fail I will report that here.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping
threads.message: You fix these with only a month warranty???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> beeping
threads.message: :-) no, i give 12 Month but now after 11 Month it had that problem again with the GPU, still one of the last HKLRF Fake GPUs I bought last year, about 40. I replaced with a real new one from the distributer we talked about already.
